Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Peter Heltzel, Associate Professor of Theology, New York Theological Seminary, 475 Riverside Drive, New York, N.Y. 10115.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Levine.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Peter Heltzel, Associate Professor of Theology, New York Theological Seminary, 475 Riverside Drive, New York, N.Y. 10115.

Council Member Levine moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 13, 2014 be adopted as printed by Council Member Treyger.
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Treyger, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 13, 2014 be adopted as printed.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the early intervention program
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Early intervention program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of homeless services to post shelter census data
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of homeless services to post shelter census data.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the operation of horse drawn cabs and pedicabs, and to repeal subdivision c of section 20-374 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to licenses for additional horse-drawn cabs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Operation of horse drawn cabs and pedicabs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling for the establishment of a commission to study the potential creation of a national Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender History Museum.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a commission to study the potential creation of a national Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender History Museum.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to include in its curriculum requirements, swimming lessons and water safety education to all students in public schools from kindergarten through 12th grade where appropriate and swimming-related instruction, such as water safety and dry land strokes to all students in public schools from kindergarten through 12th grade when their school does not have a pool in the building or is not within 10 miles of a pool where appropriate.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Include in its curriculum requirements, swimming lessons and water safety education to all students in public schools from kindergarten through 12th grade.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring Youth Day in New York City, to be held annually each year on August 12th, coinciding with International Youth Day.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Declaring Youth Day in NYC, to be held annually each year on August 12th, coinciding with International Youth Day.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to ensure an equal number of employers and union representatives on the New York City Deferred Compensation Board.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Ensure an equal number of employers and union representatives on the NYC Deferred Compensation Board.

Items.Title: Application No. 20155248 HAM submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law for a real property tax exemption for properties located at 538-548 West 53rd Street (Block 1081, part of Lot 1), Borough of the Manhattan, Community Board 4, Council District 3.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Planning, 538-548 West 53rd St, Manhattan (20155248 HAM)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a universal mobile application to enable customers to electronically hail taxicabs and street hail livery vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring a universal mobile application to enable customers to electronically hail taxicabs and street hail livery vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain city contractors to implement workplace violence prevention programs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Requiring certain city contractors to implement workplace violence prevention programs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.2819, which would establish a hospitality gift fund for the homeless.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Establish a hospitality gift fund for the homeless. (A.2819)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to match the City of New York’s commitment to create 15,000 units of supportive housing over 15 years, and the State of New York and the City of New York to approve a fourth “New York/New York Agreement” to create permanent supportive housing
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Approve a fourth “New York/New York Agreement” to create permanent supportive housing.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to speed limits in New York city parks.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Speed limits in NYC parks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the disclosure of information regarding buyout agreements.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Disclosure of information regarding buyout agreements.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting nighttime illumination for certain buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Limiting nighttime illumination for certain buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Public School Athletic League (PSAL) to provide a medical professional and an ambulance for High School Football games as well as practices in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Public School Athletic League (PSAL) to provide a medical professional and an ambulance for High School Football games as well as practices in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, A.8763-A/S.7242 legislation that would establish a task force on arts and music education in elementary and secondary schools to study and make recommendations on the curriculum and funds spent on arts and music education in the New York State elementary and secondary school system.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Establish a task force on arts and music education in elementary and secondary schools. (A.8763-A/S.7242)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on the racial and gender makeup of applicants for firefighter civil service examinations, and admission and graduation statistics from the probationary firefighter school.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Reporting on the racial and gender makeup of applicants for firefighter civil service examinations, and admission and graduation statistics from the probationary firefighter school.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to an infrastructure task force.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Infrastructure task force.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to including 311 reports as official notice to the City of unsafe street or sidewalk conditions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Including 311 reports as official notice to the City of unsafe street or sidewalk conditions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to transferring administration of the senior citizen rent increase exemption (SCRIE) and disability rent increase exemption (DRIE) programs to the department of finance.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Transferring administration of the SCRIE and DRIE programs to the dept of finance.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing e-mail and text message notifications regarding major transportation projects.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Providing e-mail and text message notifications regarding major transportation projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring reporting on crime statistics in shelters.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring reporting on crime statistics in shelters.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations

Items.Title: Application no. C 140360 PSK submitted by the Mayor’s Office of Criminal Justice Coordinator and NYC Department of Citywide Administrative Services (DCAS), pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter, for the site selection of property located at 444 Thomas S. Boyland Street (Block 3496, Lot 4), for use as a community justice center, Borough of Brooklyn, Community Board 16, Council District 41. This application is subject to the review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by a vote of the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.MinutesNote: Filed pursuant to Letter of Withdrawal.
